content.raw:
Here is example output from echo a rostopic that had point cloud data using the old ros point cloud bridge plugin:
```
header:
  seq: 61
  stamp:
    secs: 4
    nsecs:  67000000
  frame_id: "X1/base_link/front_laser"
height: 16
width: 10000
fields:
  -
    name: "x"
    offset: 0
    datatype: 7
    count: 1
  -
    name: "y"
    offset: 4
    datatype: 7
    count: 1
  -
    name: "z"
    offset: 8
    datatype: 7
    count: 1
is_bigendian: False
point_step: 16
row_step: 2560000
```
content.html:
Here is example output from echo a rostopic that had point cloud data using the old ros point cloud bridge plugin:

  seq: 61
  stamp:
    secs: 4
    nsecs:  67000000

width: 10000

  -
    name: "x"
    offset: 0
    datatype: 7
    count: 1
  -
    name: "y"
    offset: 4
    datatype: 7
    count: 1
  -
    name: "z"
    offset: 8
    datatype: 7
    count: 1
is_bigendian: False
point_step: 16
row_step: 2560000

content.html: Although...I may have captured this with two publishers (one using the old point cloud bridge, and one using the new packed converter) and I only saw the message with this error.

content.raw:
`ros1_ign_point_cloud` seems to be publishing unordered point clouds for GPU lidar. See the [demo](https://github.com/osrf/ros1_ign/blob/master/ros1_ign_point_cloud/examples/gpu_lidar.sdf#L259):

`roslaunch ros1_ign_gazebo_demos gpu_lidar.launch`

```
$ rostopic echo /custom_params/pc2 --noarr
header: 
  seq: 82
  stamp: 
    secs: 8
    nsecs: 999000000
  frame_id: "custom_params/link"
height: 1
width: 10240
fields: "<array type: sensor_msgs/PointField, length: 4>"
is_bigendian: False
point_step: 32
row_step: 327680
data: "<array type: uint8, length: 327680>"
is_dense: True
```

It has height 1 and width 640 * 16. This seems to be what's coming through [gpu_rays_->ConnectNewGpuRaysFrame](https://github.com/osrf/ros1_ign/blob/master/ros1_ign_point_cloud/src/point_cloud.cc#L316), which I think is different from the `laserBuffer` used here.
content.html:
ros1_ign_point_cloud seems to be publishing unordered point clouds for GPU lidar. See the demo:

roslaunch ros1_ign_gazebo_demos gpu_lidar.launch

$ rostopic echo /custom_params/pc2 --noarr
header: 
  seq: 82
  stamp: 
    secs: 8
    nsecs: 999000000
  frame_id: "custom_params/link"
height: 1
width: 10240
fields: "<array type: sensor_msgs/PointField, length: 4>"
is_bigendian: False
point_step: 32
row_step: 327680
data: "<array type: uint8, length: 327680>"
is_dense: True

It has height 1 and width 640 * 16. This seems to be what's coming through gpu_rays_->ConnectNewGpuRaysFrame, which I think is different from the laserBuffer used here.

content.raw: Nitpick: this sensor publishes 2 types of messages, `LaserScan` and `PointCloudPacked`. This message fills only the point cloud, so it could be called `FillPointCloudMessage`.
content.html: Nitpick: this sensor publishes 2 types of messages, LaserScan and PointCloudPacked. This message fills only the point cloud, so it could be called FillPointCloudMessage.
